$HYPE grinding +5.7% to ~$34.87 amid BTC +7% to $91.8k, total cap $3.17T (+2.1%). G&G 23 (Fear fade), dom 57.2% ‚Äì $22M vol (+20%) on Nasdaq treasury nod, 73% perp DEX share flex. (CMC/Bitget)
Quick tape:
24h vol: $22M (+20%, turnover 2x cap)
Market cap: $9.4B (#20 rank)

1/ Merger Seal: Sonnet ‚Üí Hyperliquid Strategies Live
Shareholders greenlight Sonnet BioTherapeutics + Rorschach SPAC (Dec 3) ‚Äì new Nasdaq $PURR (ex-$SONN) with $888M treasury (16.9M $HYPE ~$583M + $305M cash). Paradigm-led, Q4 close for $1B S-1 buybacks. TL;DR: First public HYPE treasury ‚Äì regulated DeFi exposure, 17% rip post-vote.
2/ Whale Load-Up: Abraxas + Levered Bets
Abraxas Capital dumps $62M into $HYPE spot ($56M total, 50% portfolio); 0xBd8c opens $20M 5x long (liq $22.72). Watch: $60M Nov 30 unlock absorbed (77% restaked/held) ‚Äì $314M Dec cliff next, but fee buybacks (97%) offset.
3/ Tech Tape: Consolidation Break Setup
4h: $36.77 res test (Fib 38.2%), close $34.87 > EMA20 ($33.7). RSI 58 (neutral bull), MACD +0.06 (up hist). BB upper $35.1. Watch: >$35.09 = $36.88 target; <$33.84 = $28.3 supp flush. Funding +0.00005 (long pay mild).
Bottom line: $HYPE's HyperBFT (10k TPS perps) + treasury = DeFi alpha ‚Äì $40 retest if $33.84 holds, $70 med-term on unlocks digest. Insti szn or supply trap? Load the coil?

AMA Recap: Derive x Hyperliquid | The New Era of Onchain Derivatives.

Our AMA delivered some of the strongest insights of the year on on-chain derivatives, market structure, and the post-10/10 landscape.

@itseneff, @KookCapitalLLC, and @HYPEconomist .

Here are the biggest takeaways üëá
üìâ 10/10 and Market Structure

‚Äú10/10 reset the entire derivatives landscape, volatility is opportunity, not risk.‚Äù

Massive forced liquidations don‚Äôt resolve quickly.  This isn‚Äôt a setback, it‚Äôs the foundation for new asymmetric opportunities.

The liquidation cascade forced a full reset in market structure. These events take time to resolve, but they reliably create the best long-term opportunities for traders accumulating quality assets.
üè¶ TradFi Inflows & Hyperliquid‚Äôs Advantage

HYPEconomist explained why institutional money will migrate naturally toward Hyperliquid: ‚ÄúTradFi understands exchanges. Hyperliquid is the first one built natively for the internet.‚Äù
üí∞ Smart Money Rotation ‚Üí Bitcoin, ETH, Hyperliquid

This cycle marked a major shift: retail overexposure and meme excess were flushed out, while disciplined capital concentrated into fundamentals like BTC, ETH, and Hyperliquid. The next cycle is driven by utility, revenue, and efficiency: not hype.
üîç Derive‚Äôs Role in the Onchain Options & Margin Future

The next trillion in derivatives volume will be onchain.
Hyperliquid is locking in the liquidity layer, and Derive is quietly building the margin + options + collateral infrastructure that everything else will need. Onchain perps were step one. Unified margin, collateral routing, and scalable options are step two.

Derive and Hyperliquid sit directly at that intersection.

$HYPE  1h: Bullish Sentiment Under Review   The market is showing strong bullish momentum, hovering just below a key supply zone that could dictate the next major moves.   Currently, the price sits around 35.0, facing potential resistance in the zone between 35.15 and 36.0. A dip toward support levels at 34.22 or 33.42 may present ideal buying opportunities, especially if a bullish reversal pattern forms at these points. Should the price convincingly break above the supply zone at 36.0, the outlook remains optimistic, with targets at approximately 36.77 and possibly reaching 39.0. However, if it breaches below 33.4, a reassessment for bearish trends may be warranted.   This snapshot leaves out the crucial levels. $HYPE is showing solid bullish momentum, trading just beneath a key supply zone that will likely shape its next move.

Price is hovering near 35.0, with resistance between 35.15 and 36.0. A pullback toward 34.22 or 33.42 could offer better entry points if a reversal forms. A clean break above 36.0 would keep the bullish outlook intact, opening targets around 36.77 and possibly 39.0. But a drop below 33.4 would signal the need to watch for bearish momentum instead.

#HYPE  LTF Analysis:  $HYPE  is shaping a clean double bottom structure on the 4H, with $HYPE  aggressively defending the recent lows and showing strong buyer absorption at the base. The sharp rebound from the second bottom signals a shift in short-term momentum, while structure is now resetting beneath a well-defined resistance zone.  The neckline is the key trigger from here. A strong reclaim and close above that level would complete the pattern and confirm a bullish reversal, opening the door for the next upside leg. As long as $HYPE  continues to hold above the base, momentum remains in favor of further upside continuation.   Telegram: t.me/alphaCryptoSignal

Breaking news from yesterday

- Polymarket‚Äôs US app launched Wednesday for waitlist users, marking its return to America since the CFTC banned it in early 2022

- Ethereum‚Äôs Fusaka upgrade deployed successfully. It introduces, PeerDAS (EIP-7594) which allows validators to sample data segments instead of downloading full blobs, enabling higher blob throughput without increasing node bandwidth, enabling 8x data throughput for L2s, Block gas limit increases by 33% to 60M gas, etc

- Ostium Labs raised $24M, Series A led by General Catalyst and Jump Crypto for their Arbitrum-based perp DEX trading stocks, commodities, forex, and crypto.

- Solana mobile plans to launch on January 2026, with 10 billion total supply and 30% for airdrop and unlock 

- Franklin Templeton launched its Solana ETF (ticker: SOEZ) on NYSE Arca Wednesday, adding to its crypto product lineup

- Kinetiq launched Markets on Hyperliquid, a 24/7 onchain trading platform for perps, stocks, commodities, and global markets with ultra-low latency and 200K TPS. It Introduces kmHYPE, the first exLST capturing Markets revenue. Fixed supply of 888,888, only KNTQ holders can mint (FCFS Dec 8), and kmHYPE holders receive 10% of all Markets revenue

- Firelightfi launched an XRP staking protocol on Flare issuing stXRP, a liquid token for a DeFi insurance model 

- Axis raised $5M led by Galaxy Ventures to launch an onchain yield protocol for USD, bitcoin, and gold. Backers include OKX Ventures, CMT Digital, FalconX, GSR, Maven 11, CMS Holdings, and Aave‚Äôs Marc Zeller.

- Haiku formerly Mozaic closed a $1M pre seed round led by BigBrain VC

Integration with @HyperliquidX

DIA oracles are now live on HyperEVM, bringing verifiable data infrastructure to one of DeFi's highest-performance ecosystems.

Trustless oracles for next-generation DeFi.

üßµ 
Hyperliquid represents next-generation DeFi infrastructure with its fully onchain order book designed for institutional-grade performance.

Developers now have access to verifiable oracle feeds with complete transparency for building secure, data-driven applications.
DIA oracles on Hyperliquid enable:

‚Ä¢ Lending and borrowing protocols with reliable collateral pricing
‚Ä¢ Algorithmic stablecoins backed by verifiable feeds
‚Ä¢ Perpetual and derivatives platforms with real-time data
‚Ä¢ Cross-chain bridges with secure price references
DIA integrates directly with Hyperliquid's chain-native DEXs, capturing real-time trade data from the protocol's onchain order book.

This enables robust price feeds for Hyperliquid-native assets, essential for a thriving DeFi ecosystem on the platform.
Every oracle computation runs through Lumina, DIA's rollup infrastructure that makes calculations verifiable onchain.

Traditional oracles aggregate data offchain. DIA brings oracle logic onchain, ensuring complete transparency for every price feed. 
DIA delivers 20,000+ price feeds across digital assets and real-world assets, sourced from 100+ direct integrations.

All data is fetched from primary sources with the highest data fidelity. No reliance on opaque, third-party aggregators.
Developers can start building with DIA oracles on HyperEVM today.

‚Üí Explore feeds: https://diadata.org/app/
‚Üí Integration docs: https://diadata.org/docs/

Learn more about this integration: https://www.diadata.org/blog/post/dia-oracles-integrated-with-hyperevm/
